symptoms_patient_terms: Severe throbbing pain 2–3 days after extraction
probable_causes: Dislodged clot due to smoking, spitting, straw use
do_now: Avoid smoking, spitting, and straw use
Warm salt-water rinses after meals (as advised)
Over-the-counter pain relief if safe for you
donts: Don’t poke or suck the socket
Don’t apply home remedies or heat into the socket

urgency_modifiers.why: Fever suggests infection, not just dry socket

pediatric: Less common; verify extraction site care with guardian
pregnancy_nursing: Avoid smoking; dentist will choose safe pain medicines
systemic_notes: CKD/liver disease: confirm safe pain medicines with physician; smokers have higher risk

prevention: No smoking or straws for several days
Gentle rinses as advised; keep area clean
